I want to build a CRM web application with a clean, modern UI using a dark blue and blue color palette. The app should include user authentication (sign up, login, password reset) and have core CRM features like managing contacts, tracking leads, adding notes, tagging, and a basic dashboard. Lets focus on this basic functionality first

from fastapi import FastAPI
from fastapi.middleware.cors import CORSMiddleware
from services import api_router

app = FastAPI(title="Project Backend", version="1.0.0")

# CORS configuration for frontend
app.add_middleware(
    CORSMiddleware,
    allow_origins=["*"],
    allow_credentials=True,
    allow_methods=["*"],
    allow_headers=["*"],
)

# Include the main router
app.include_router(api_router)

@app.get("/")
def read_root():
    return {"status": "Backend running"}

@app.get("/health")
def health_check():
    return {"status": "healthy"}

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import uvicorn
    uvicorn.run(app, host="0.0.0.0", port=8000)
```

from fastapi import APIRouter
from pydantic import BaseModel
from datetime import datetime

router = APIRouter()

class HealthResponse(BaseModel):
    status: str
    timestamp: str
    service: str

@router.get("/health", response_model=HealthResponse)
async def health_check():
    return HealthResponse(
        status="healthy",
        timestamp=datetime.now().isoformat(),
        service="backend"
    )
```

from pydantic import BaseModel, EmailStr, Field
from typing import Optional

# Pydantic v2 - simple user models for API surface
class UserBase(BaseModel):
    username: str = Field(..., min_length=3)
    email: EmailStr
    full_name: Optional[str] = None
    is_active: bool = True

class UserCreate(UserBase):
    password: str = Field(..., min_length=6)

class UserRead(UserBase):
    id: int

class UserInDB(UserRead):
    hashed_password: str

from pydantic import BaseModel, Field
from typing import Optional, List
from enum import Enum

class LeadStatus(str, Enum):
    new = "new"
    contacted = "contacted"
    qualified = "qualified"
    lost = "lost"
    won = "won"

class LeadBase(BaseModel):
    title: str = Field(..., min_length=1)
    description: Optional[str] = None
    value: Optional[float] = None
    status: LeadStatus = LeadStatus.new
    contact_ids: List[int] = Field(default_factory=list)
    tags: List[str] = Field(default_factory=list)

class LeadCreate(LeadBase):
    pass

I'll add simple backend services for authentication and contacts (in-memory storage for MVP), include them in the main service router, start the backend, and run an integration test script that uses the BACKEND_URL environment variable.

Adding auth and contact services now.

<action type="file" filePath="backend/services/auth_service.py">
from fastapi import APIRouter, HTTPException, status, Depends, Header
from typing import Optional, Dict
from uuid import uuid4
import hashlib
from models.user import UserCreate, UserRead, UserInDB
import time

router = APIRouter(prefix="/auth")

# Simple in-memory stores for MVP
_users: Dict[int, UserInDB] = {}
_email_to_id: Dict[str, int] = {}
_tokens: Dict[str, int] = {}
_next_user_id = 1

def _hash_password(password: str) -> str:
    # Simple SHA256 hashing with a static salt for MVP (not for production)
    salt = "mvp_salt_2025"
    return hashlib.sha256(f"{salt}{password}".encode("utf-8")).hexdigest()

@router.post("/signup/", response_model=UserRead, status_code=status.HTTP_201_CREATED)
async def signup(payload: UserCreate):
    global _next_user_id
    if payload.email in _email_to_id:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=400, detail="Email already registered")
    hashed = _hash_password(payload.password)
    user_in_db = UserInDB(
        id=_next_user_id,
        username=payload.username,
        email=payload.email,
        full_name=payload.full_name,
        is_active=True,
        hashed_password=hashed
    )
    _users[_next_user_id] = user_in_db
    _email_to_id[payload.email] = _next_user_id
    _next_user_id += 1
    return UserRead(
        id=user_in_db.id,
        username=user_in_db.username,
        email=user_in_db.email,
        full_name=user_in_db.full_name,
        is_active=user_in_db.is_active
    )

class LoginRequest(UserCreate):
    # reuse fields: username, email, password - login will accept email + password
    pass

@router.post("/login/")
async def login(email: str, password: str):
    # simple query params/body handling via function signature
    if email not in _email_to_id:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=400, detail="Invalid credentials")
    user_id = _email_to_id[email]
    user = _users[user_id]
    if user.hashed_password != _hash_password(password):
        raise HTTPException(status_code=400, detail="Invalid credentials")
    token = str(uuid4())
    _tokens[token] = user_id
    # return token and user summary
    return {"access_token": token, "token_type": "bearer", "user": {"id": user.id, "email": user.email, "username": user.username}}

# Dependency to get current user from Authorization header
async def get_current_user(authorization: Optional[str] = Header(None)):
    if not authorization:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=401, detail="Missing authorization header")
    # Expect "Bearer <token>"
    parts = authorization.split()
    if len(parts) != 2 or parts[0].lower() != "bearer":
        raise HTTPException(status_code=401, detail="Invalid authorization header")
    token = parts[1]
    user_id = _tokens.get(token)
    if not user_id:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=401, detail="Invalid token")
    return _users[user_id]

@router.get("/me/", response_model=UserRead)
async def me(current: UserInDB = Depends(get_current_user)):
    return UserRead(
        id=current.id,
        username=current.username,
        email=current.email,
        full_name=current.full_name,
        is_active=current.is_active
    )
</action>

<action type="file" filePath="backend/services/contacts_service.py">
from fastapi import APIRouter, HTTPException, status, Depends
from typing import Dict, List
from models.contact import ContactCreate, ContactRead
from .auth_service import get_current_user
from models.user import UserInDB

router = APIRouter(prefix="/contacts")

# Simple in-memory store
_contacts: Dict[int, Dict] = {}
_next_contact_id = 1

@router.post("/", response_model=ContactRead, status_code=status.HTTP_201_CREATED)
async def create_contact(payload: ContactCreate, current: UserInDB = Depends(get_current_user)):
    global _next_contact_id
    contact = payload.model_dump()
    contact_id = _next_contact_id
    contact_record = {"id": contact_id, **contact, "owner_id": current.id}
    _contacts[contact_id] = contact_record
    _next_contact_id += 1
    return ContactRead(**contact_record)

@router.get("/", response_model=List[ContactRead])
async def list_contacts(current: UserInDB = Depends(get_current_user)):
    # Return contacts owned by current user
    return [ContactRead(**c) for c in _contacts.values() if c.get("owner_id") == current.id]

@router.get("/{contact_id}/", response_model=ContactRead)
async def get_contact(contact_id: int, current: UserInDB = Depends(get_current_user)):
    contact = _contacts.get(contact_id)
    if not contact or contact.get("owner_id") != current.id:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Contact not found")
    return ContactRead(**contact)

@router.put("/{contact_id}/", response_model=ContactRead)
async def update_contact(contact_id: int, payload: ContactCreate, current: UserInDB = Depends(get_current_user)):
    contact = _contacts.get(contact_id)
    if not contact or contact.get("owner_id") != current.id:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Contact not found")
    updated = payload.model_dump()
    contact.update(updated)
    _contacts[contact_id] = contact
    return ContactRead(**contact)

@router.delete("/{contact_id}/", status_code=status.HTTP_204_NO_CONTENT)
async def delete_contact(contact_id: int, current: UserInDB = Depends(get_current_user)):
    contact = _contacts.get(contact_id)
    if not contact or contact.get("owner_id") != current.id:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Contact not found")
    del _contacts[contact_id]
    return None
</action>

import os
import json
import urllib.request
import urllib.parse
import sys
import time

BACKEND_URL = os.environ.get('BACKEND_URL')
if not BACKEND_URL:
    print("ERROR: BACKEND_URL environment variable not set. Start the backend using the prescribed action.")
    sys.exit(1)

def post_json(path, data):
    url = f"{BACKEND_URL}{path}"
    body = json.dumps(data).encode("utf-8")
    req = urllib.request.Request(url, data=body, headers={"Content-Type": "application/json"}, method="POST")
    with urllib.request.urlopen(req) as resp:
        return json.loads(resp.read().decode())

def post_no_body(path):
    url = f"{BACKEND_URL}{path}"
    req = urllib.request.Request(url, data=b"", method="POST")
    with urllib.request.urlopen(req) as resp:
        return json.loads(resp.read().decode())

def get_json(path, token=None):
    url = f"{BACKEND_URL}{path}"
    headers = {}
    if token:
        headers["Authorization"] = f"Bearer {token}"
    req = urllib.request.Request(url, headers=headers)
    with urllib.request.urlopen(req) as resp:
        data = resp.read().decode()
        if data:
            return json.loads(data)
        return None

def main():
    print("Starting backend integration test...")

    # 1) Signup a user
    user = {
        "username": "alice",
        "email": "alice@example.com",
        "password": "password123",
        "full_name": "Alice Example"
    }
    print("Signing up user...")
    signup_resp = post_json("/auth/signup/", user)
    print("Signup response:", signup_resp)

    # 2) Login the user - login endpoint expects query params email and password
    print("Logging in user...")
    login_url_path = f"/auth/login/?email={urllib.parse.quote(user['email'])}&password={urllib.parse.quote(user['password'])}"
    login_resp = post_no_body(login_url_path)
    print("Login response:", login_resp)
    token = login_resp.get("access_token")
    if not token:
        print("ERROR: no token returned")
        sys.exit(1)

    # 3) Create a contact
    contact = {
        "name": "Bob Builder",
        "email": "bob@example.com",
        "phone": "555-1234",
        "company": "Builder Co",
        "title": "CTO",
        "tags": ["prospect"]
    }
    print("Creating contact...")
    req = urllib.request.Request(f"{BACKEND_URL}/contacts/", data=json.dumps(contact).encode("utf-8"),
                                 headers={"Content-Type": "application/json", "Authorization": f"Bearer {token}"}, method="POST")
    with urllib.request.urlopen(req) as resp:
        created = json.loads(resp.read().decode())
    print("Created contact:", created)

    # 4) List contacts
    print("Listing contacts...")
    contacts = get_json("/contacts/", token=token)
    print("Contacts list:", contacts)

    # Basic checks
    assert isinstance(contacts, list), "Contacts should be a list"
    assert any(c["email"] == contact["email"] for c in contacts), "Created contact not found in list"

    print("All integration tests passed!")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()
</action>

```
import os
import json
import urllib.request
import urllib.parse
import sys
import time

BACKEND_URL = os.environ.get('BACKEND_URL')
if not BACKEND_URL:
    print("ERROR: BACKEND_URL environment variable not set. Start the backend using the prescribed action.")
    sys.exit(1)

def post_json(path, data):
    url = f"{BACKEND_URL}{path}"
    body = json.dumps(data).encode("utf-8")
    req = urllib.request.Request(url, data=body, headers={"Content-Type": "application/json"}, method="POST")
    with urllib.request.urlopen(req) as resp:
        return json.loads(resp.read().decode())

def post_no_body(path):
    url = f"{BACKEND_URL}{path}"
    req = urllib.request.Request(url, data=b"", method="POST")
    with urllib.request.urlopen(req) as resp:
        return json.loads(resp.read().decode())

def get_json(path, token=None):
    url = f"{BACKEND_URL}{path}"
    headers = {}
    if token:
        headers["Authorization"] = f"Bearer {token}"
    req = urllib.request.Request(url, headers=headers)
    with urllib.request.urlopen(req) as resp:
        data = resp.read().decode()
        if data:
            return json.loads(data)
        return None

def main():
    print("Starting backend integration test...")

    # 1) Signup a user
    user = {
        "username": "alice",
        "email": "alice@example.com",
        "password": "password123",
        "full_name": "Alice Example"
    }
    print("Signing up user...")
    signup_resp = post_json("/auth/signup/", user)
    print("Signup response:", signup_resp)

    # 2) Login the user - login endpoint expects query params email and password
    print("Logging in user...")
    login_url_path = f"/auth/login/?email={urllib.parse.quote(user['email'])}&password={urllib.parse.quote(user['password'])}"
    login_resp = post_no_body(login_url_path)
    print("Login response:", login_resp)
    token = login_resp.get("access_token")
    if not token:
        print("ERROR: no token returned")
        sys.exit(1)

    # 3) Create a contact
    contact = {
        "name": "Bob Builder",
        "email": "bob@example.com",
        "phone": "555-1234",
        "company": "Builder Co",
        "title": "CTO",
        "tags": ["prospect"]
    }
    print("Creating contact...")
    req = urllib.request.Request(f"{BACKEND_URL}/contacts/", data=json.dumps(contact).encode("utf-8"),
                                 headers={"Content-Type": "application/json", "Authorization": f"Bearer {token}"}, method="POST")
    with urllib.request.urlopen(req) as resp:
        created = json.loads(resp.read().decode())
    print("Created contact:", created)

    # 4) List contacts
    print("Listing contacts...")
    contacts = get_json("/contacts/", token=token)
    print("Contacts list:", contacts)

    # Basic checks
    assert isinstance(contacts, list), "Contacts should be a list"
    assert any(c["email"] == contact["email"] for c in contacts), "Created contact not found in list"

    print("All integration tests passed!")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()
```

from fastapi import APIRouter, HTTPException, status, Depends, Header
from typing import Optional, Dict
from uuid import uuid4
import hashlib
from models.user import UserCreate, UserRead, UserInDB
import time

router = APIRouter(prefix="/auth")

# Simple in-memory stores for MVP
_users: Dict[int, UserInDB] = {}
_email_to_id: Dict[str, int] = {}
_tokens: Dict[str, int] = {}
_next_user_id = 1

def _hash_password(password: str) -> str:
    # Simple SHA256 hashing with a static salt for MVP (not for production)
    salt = "mvp_salt_2025"
    return hashlib.sha256(f"{salt}{password}".encode("utf-8")).hexdigest()

@router.post("/signup/", response_model=UserRead, status_code=status.HTTP_201_CREATED)
async def signup(payload: UserCreate):
    global _next_user_id
    if payload.email in _email_to_id:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=400, detail="Email already registered")
    hashed = _hash_password(payload.password)
    user_in_db = UserInDB(
        id=_next_user_id,
        username=payload.username,
        email=payload.email,
        full_name=payload.full_name,
        is_active=True,
        hashed_password=hashed
    )
    _users[_next_user_id] = user_in_db
    _email_to_id[payload.email] = _next_user_id
    _next_user_id += 1
    return UserRead(
        id=user_in_db.id,
        username=user_in_db.username,
        email=user_in_db.email,
        full_name=user_in_db.full_name,
        is_active=user_in_db.is_active
    )

class LoginRequest(UserCreate):
    # reuse fields: username, email, password - login will accept email + password
    pass

@router.post("/login/")
async def login(email: str, password: str):
    # simple query params/body handling via function signature
    if email not in _email_to_id:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=400, detail="Invalid credentials")
    user_id = _email_to_id[email]
    user = _users[user_id]
    if user.hashed_password != _hash_password(password):
        raise HTTPException(status_code=400, detail="Invalid credentials")
    token = str(uuid4())
    _tokens[token] = user_id
    # return token and user summary
    return {"access_token": token, "token_type": "bearer", "user": {"id": user.id, "email": user.email, "username": user.username}}

# Dependency to get current user from Authorization header
async def get_current_user(authorization: Optional[str] = Header(None)):
    if not authorization:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=401, detail="Missing authorization header")
    # Expect "Bearer <token>"
    parts = authorization.split()
    if len(parts) != 2 or parts[0].lower() != "bearer":
        raise HTTPException(status_code=401, detail="Invalid authorization header")
    token = parts[1]
    user_id = _tokens.get(token)
    if not user_id:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=401, detail="Invalid token")
    return _users[user_id]

@router.get("/me/", response_model=UserRead)
async def me(current: UserInDB = Depends(get_current_user)):
    return UserRead(
        id=current.id,
        username=current.username,
        email=current.email,
        full_name=current.full_name,
        is_active=current.is_active
    )

# CRM Application Implementation Plan

## Backend
1. **Authentication System**

   - JWT token authentication

2. **Core Models**
   - Contact: name, email, phone, company, tags

   - Tag: name, color

   - CRUD for all models
   - Dashboard summary endpoint

## Frontend
1. **Authentication Flows**
   - Signup, login, password reset pages
   - Protected routes

2. **Contact Management**
   - Contact list view
   - Contact detail view
   - Create/edit contact form

3. **Lead Tracking**
   - Lead pipeline view
   - Lead detail view
   - Status update workflow

4. **Dashboard**
   - Summary statistics
   - Recent activity feed

## Styling
- Dark blue primary color (#1e3a8a)
- Blue accent color (#3b82f6)
- Modern card-based layout
- Responsive design

## Testing
- Backend API tests
- Frontend component tests
- End-to-end user flow tests

from pydantic import BaseModel, EmailStr
from typing import Optional
from enum import Enum

class UserRole(str, Enum):
    ADMIN = "admin"
    USER = "user"

class UserBase(BaseModel):
    email: EmailStr
    full_name: str
    role: UserRole = UserRole.USER

class UserCreate(UserBase):
    password: str

class UserInDB(UserBase):
    id: int
    hashed_password: str
    is_active: bool = True

class UserRead(UserBase):
    id: int
    is_active: bool

<action type="file" filePath="backend/test_auth.py">
import requests
import json

BASE_URL = "http://localhost:8004/auth"

def test_auth_flow():
    # Test signup
    signup_data = {
        "email": "test@example.com",
        "full_name": "Test User",
        "password": "password123",
        "role": "user"
    }
    signup_response = requests.post(f"{BASE_URL}/signup", json=signup_data)
    print(f"Signup Response: {signup_response.status_code}")
    print(signup_response.json())
    
    # Test login
    login_data = {
        "username": "test@example.com",
        "password": "password123"
    }
    login_response = requests.post(f"{BASE_URL}/login", data=login_data)
    print(f"\nLogin Response: {login_response.status_code}")
    login_result = login_response.json()
    print(login_result)
    
    # Test getting current user
    token = login_result.get("access_token")
    headers = {"Authorization": f"Bearer {token}"}
    me_response = requests.get(f"{BASE_URL}/me", headers=headers)
    print(f"\nCurrent User Response: {me_response.status_code}")
    print(me_response.json())
    
    # Test password reset
    reset_response = requests.post(f"{BASE_URL}/reset-password", params={"email": "test@example.com"})
    print(f"\nPassword Reset Response: {reset_response.status_code}")
    print(reset_response.json())

if __name__ == "__main__":
    test_auth_flow()
</action>

from services import api_router

)

    uvicorn.run(app, host="0.0.0.0", port=8000)

```xml
<action type="update_file" path="backend/test_auth.py">
import requests
import json

BASE_URL = "http://localhost:8004/auth"

def test_auth_flow():
    # Test signup
    signup_data = {
        "email": "test@example.com",
        "full_name": "Test User",
        "password": "password123",
        "role": "user"
    }
    signup_response = requests.post(f"{BASE_URL}/signup/", json=signup_data)
    print(f"Signup Response: {signup_response.status_code}")
    print(signup_response.json())
    
    # Test login
    login_data = {
        "username": "test@example.com",
        "password": "password123"
    }
    login_response = requests.post(f"{BASE_URL}/login/", data=login_data)
    print(f"\nLogin Response: {login_response.status_code}")
    login_result = login_response.json()
    print(login_result)
    
    # Test getting current user
    token = login_result.get("access_token")
    headers = {"Authorization": f"Bearer {token}"}
    me_response = requests.get(f"{BASE_URL}/me/", headers=headers)
    print(f"\nCurrent User Response: {me_response.status_code}")
    print(me_response.json())
    
    # Test password reset
    reset_response = requests.post(f"{BASE_URL}/reset-password/", params={"email": "test@example.com"})
    print(f"\nPassword Reset Response: {reset_response.status_code}")
    print(reset_response.json())

if __name__ == "__main__":
    test_auth_flow()
</action>
```

<action type="update_file" path="backend/app.py">
from fastapi import FastAPI
from fastapi.middleware.cors import CORSMiddleware
from services import api_router
import services  # Ensure services module is fully loaded

app = FastAPI(title="Project Backend", version="1.0.0")

# CORS configuration for frontend
app.add_middleware(
    CORSMiddleware,
    allow_origins=["*"],
    allow_credentials=True,
    allow_methods=["*"],
    allow_headers=["*"],
)

# Include the main router
app.include_router(api_router)

@app.get("/")
def read_root():
    return {"status": "Backend running"}

@app.get("/health")
def health_check():
    return {"status": "healthy"}

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import uvicorn
    uvicorn.run(app, host="0.0.0.0", port=8000)
</action>

File content for backend/services/contacts_service.py:

```
from fastapi import APIRouter, HTTPException, status, Depends
from typing import Dict, List
from models.contact import ContactCreate, ContactRead
from .auth_service import get_current_user
from models.user import UserInDB

router = APIRouter(prefix="/contacts")

# Simple in-memory store
_contacts: Dict[int, Dict] = {}
_next_contact_id = 1

@router.post("/", response_model=ContactRead, status_code=status.HTTP_201_CREATED)
async def create_contact(payload: ContactCreate, current: UserInDB = Depends(get_current_user)):
    global _next_contact_id
    contact = payload.model_dump()
    contact_id = _next_contact_id
    contact_record = {"id": contact_id, **contact, "owner_id": current.id}
    _contacts[contact_id] = contact_record
    _next_contact_id += 1
    return ContactRead(**contact_record)

@router.get("/", response_model=List[ContactRead])
async def list_contacts(current: UserInDB = Depends(get_current_user)):
    # Return contacts owned by current user
    return [ContactRead(**c) for c in _contacts.values() if c.get("owner_id") == current.id]

@router.get("/{contact_id}/", response_model=ContactRead)
async def get_contact(contact_id: int, current: UserInDB = Depends(get_current_user)):
    contact = _contacts.get(contact_id)
    if not contact or contact.get("owner_id") != current.id:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Contact not found")
    return ContactRead(**contact)

@router.put("/{contact_id}/", response_model=ContactRead)
async def update_contact(contact_id: int, payload: ContactCreate, current: UserInDB = Depends(get_current_user)):
    contact = _contacts.get(contact_id)
    if not contact or contact.get("owner_id") != current.id:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Contact not found")
    updated = payload.model_dump()
    contact.update(updated)
    _contacts[contact_id] = contact
    return ContactRead(**contact)

@router.delete("/{contact_id}/", status_code=status.HTTP_204_NO_CONTENT)
async def delete_contact(contact_id: int, current: UserInDB = Depends(get_current_user)):
    contact = _contacts.get(contact_id)
    if not contact or contact.get("owner_id") != current.id:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Contact not found")
    del _contacts[contact_id]
    return None
```

I'll now create the contact service with CRUD endpoints.

```xml
<action type="file" filePath="backend/services/contacts_service.py">
from fastapi import APIRouter, HTTPException, status, Depends
from typing import Dict, List
from models.contact import ContactCreate, ContactRead
from services.auth_service import get_current_user
from models.user import UserInDB

router = APIRouter(prefix="/contacts")

# Simple in-memory store
_contacts: Dict[int, Dict] = {}
_next_contact_id = 1

@router.post("/", response_model=ContactRead, status_code=status.HTTP_201_CREATED)
async def create_contact(payload: ContactCreate, current: UserInDB = Depends(get_current_user)):
    global _next_contact_id
    contact = payload.model_dump()
    contact_id = _next_contact_id
    contact_record = {"id": contact_id, **contact, "owner_id": current.id}
    _contacts[contact_id] = contact_record
    _next_contact_id += 1
    return ContactRead(**contact_record)

@router.get("/", response_model=List[ContactRead])
async def list_contacts(current: UserInDB = Depends(get_current_user)):
    # Return contacts owned by current user
    return [ContactRead(**c) for c in _contacts.values() if c.get("owner_id") == current.id]

@router.get("/{contact_id}/", response_model=ContactRead)
async def get_contact(contact_id: int, current: UserInDB = Depends(get_current_user)):
    contact = _contacts.get(contact_id)
    if not contact or contact.get("owner_id") != current.id:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Contact not found")
    return ContactRead(**contact)

@router.put("/{contact_id}/", response_model=ContactRead)
async def update_contact(contact_id: int, payload: ContactCreate, current: UserInDB = Depends(get_current_user)):
    contact = _contacts.get(contact_id)
    if not contact or contact.get("owner_id") != current.id:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Contact not found")
    updated = payload.model_dump()
    contact.update(updated)
    _contacts[contact_id] = contact
    return ContactRead(**contact)

@router.delete("/{contact_id}/", status_code=status.HTTP_204_NO_CONTENT)
async def delete_contact(contact_id: int, current: UserInDB = Depends(get_current_user)):
    contact = _contacts.get(contact_id)
    if not contact or contact.get("owner_id") != current.id:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Contact not found")
    del _contacts[contact_id]
    return None
</action>

1. Create a comprehensive test script to verify all authentication and contacts endpoints
2. Run the test script to ensure the backend is fully functional
3. Mark the backend fix as complete

```xml
<action type="file" filePath="backend/test_all_endpoints.py">
import os
import requests
import json

# Get backend URL from environment variable
BACKEND_URL = os.environ.get('BACKEND_URL', 'http://localhost:8004')

def print_response(response, title):
    print(f"\n{title} - Status: {response.status_code}")
    try:
        print(json.dumps(response.json(), indent=2))
    except:
        print(response.text)

def test_auth_and_contacts():
    # Test signup
    signup_data = {
        "email": "test@example.com",
        "full_name": "Test User",
        "password": "password123",
        "role": "user"
    }
    signup_response = requests.post(f"{BACKEND_URL}/auth/signup/", json=signup_data)
    print_response(signup_response, "Signup")
    
    # Test login
    login_data = {
        "username": "test@example.com",
        "password": "password123"
    }
    login_response = requests.post(f"{BACKEND_URL}/auth/login/", data=login_data)
    print_response(login_response, "Login")
    token = login_response.json().get("access_token")
    
    # Test getting current user
    headers = {"Authorization": f"Bearer {token}"}
    me_response = requests.get(f"{BACKEND_URL}/auth/me/", headers=headers)
    print_response(me_response, "Current User")
    
    # Create contact
    contact_data = {
        "name": "John Doe",
        "email": "john@example.com",
        "phone": "123-456-7890",
        "company": "Acme Inc",
        "title": "CEO",
        "tags": ["VIP", "Client"]
    }
    contact_response = requests.post(f"{BACKEND_URL}/contacts/", json=contact_data, headers=headers)
    print_response(contact_response, "Create Contact")
    contact_id = contact_response.json().get("id")
    
    # List contacts
    list_response = requests.get(f"{BACKEND_URL}/contacts/", headers=headers)
    print_response(list_response, "List Contacts")
    
    # Get single contact
    get_response = requests.get(f"{BACKEND_URL}/contacts/{contact_id}/", headers=headers)
    print_response(get_response, "Get Contact")
    
    # Update contact
    update_data = {"phone": "987-654-3210"}
    update_response = requests.put(f"{BACKEND_URL}/contacts/{contact_id}/", json=update_data, headers=headers)
    print_response(update_response, "Update Contact")
    
    # Delete contact
    delete_response = requests.delete(f"{BACKEND_URL}/contacts/{contact_id}/", headers=headers)
    print_response(delete_response, "Delete Contact")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    test_auth_and_contacts()
</action>

I'll create the lead service with CRUD endpoints:

```xml
<action type="file" filePath="backend/services/leads_service.py">
from fastapi import APIRouter, HTTPException, status, Depends
from typing import Dict, List
from models.lead import LeadCreate, LeadRead, LeadStatus
from services.auth_service import get_current_user
from models.user import UserInDB

router = APIRouter(prefix="/leads")

# Simple in-memory store
_leads: Dict[int, Dict] = {}
_next_lead_id = 1

@router.post("/", response_model=LeadRead, status_code=status.HTTP_201_CREATED)
async def create_lead(payload: LeadCreate, current: UserInDB = Depends(get_current_user)):
    global _next_lead_id
    lead = payload.model_dump()
    lead_id = _next_lead_id
    lead_record = {"id": lead_id, **lead, "owner_id": current.id}
    _leads[lead_id] = lead_record
    _next_lead_id += 1
    return LeadRead(**lead_record)

@router.get("/", response_model=List[LeadRead])
async def list_leads(current: UserInDB = Depends(get_current_user)):
    # Return leads owned by current user
    return [LeadRead(**l) for l in _leads.values() if l.get("owner_id") == current.id]

@router.get("/{lead_id}/", response_model=LeadRead)
async def get_lead(lead_id: int, current: UserInDB = Depends(get_current_user)):
    lead = _leads.get(lead_id)
    if not lead or lead.get("owner_id") != current.id:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Lead not found")
    return LeadRead(**lead)

@router.put("/{lead_id}/", response_model=LeadRead)
async def update_lead(lead_id: int, payload: LeadCreate, current: UserInDB = Depends(get_current_user)):
    lead = _leads.get(lead_id)
    if not lead or lead.get("owner_id") != current.id:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Lead not found")
    updated = payload.model_dump()
    lead.update(updated)
    _leads[lead_id] = lead
    return LeadRead(**lead)

@router.delete("/{lead_id}/", status_code=status.HTTP_204_NO_CONTENT)
async def delete_lead(lead_id: int, current: UserInDB = Depends(get_current_user)):
    lead = _leads.get(lead_id)
    if not lead or lead.get("owner_id") != current.id:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Lead not found")
    del _leads[lead_id]
    return None
</action>

2. Implement auth context for state management:
```tsx
// Create AuthContext.ts
const AuthContext = createContext();
export const useAuth = () => useContext(AuthContext);

export const AuthProvider = ({ children }) => {
  const [user, setUser] = useState(null);
  
  const login = async (credentials) => {
    const data = await authService.login(credentials);
    setUser(data.user);
  };
  
  return (
    <AuthContext.Provider value={{ user, login }}>
      {children}
    </AuthContext.Provider>
  );
}
```
